definition: to pick up/to collate or arrange/ten (banker's anti-fraud numeral)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Stock pups can be better but still acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 原装拾音器不够好，不过也可以接受。

sentences.english: The first real innovations toward electric axes, however, came with the awarding of two patents for magnetic pickups.
sentences.chinese: 第一次电子吉他的创新始于磁性拾音器的两项专利。

sentences.english: It has separate microphone pickups and amplifiers for each string.
sentences.chinese: 每根琴弦都有各自独立的拾音器和放大器。

sentences.english: With neck pick-up, bass tones begins to dominate general sound.
sentences.chinese: 要是施用琴颈拾音器，低音变的很低沉。

definition: loudspeaker box/speaker (audio equipment)/resonating chamber of a musical instrument/sound box
fingerboard (of a guitar or violin etc)
to receive a radio signal/to make an audio recording/(of an auditorium etc) to have good acoustics/(vocal training, linguistics) ending (of a word or syllable)
